subject: Career
title: Signing Bonuses: The Hidden Lever
description: A quick, practical guide to Signing Bonuses: The Hidden Lever.

hook.text: The base salary is at budget maximum. But the recruiter hints: 'Have you considered a signing bonus?'

buildup.text: Signing bonuses come from a different budget line. They bypass the constraints on base salary.

discovery.text: They're one-time costs for the company â€” easier to approve than permanent salary increases.

twist.text: But signing bonuses don't compound. A $10K bonus this year is gone. A $10K base raise pays forever.

climax.text: Use signing bonuses to bridge gaps: 'If the base can't move, could a signing bonus help close this?'

punchline.text: When salary is stuck, bonuses unlock the door.

quiz.question: Why are signing bonuses easier for companies to approve?
options: They're one-time costs from a different budget
